intro: Hieracium breviscapum var. glabratum, commonly known as the smooth-haired hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems that become glabrous (smooth) with age. Its basal leaves are broadly lanceolate, and the flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks.
